data.text: Despite this movie being plot & action driven, there’s a lot of emotion from these characters. Great emotional ending fight scene. Overall How To Your Dragon 2 is up there as one of the better sequels. Incredible animation & action with great characters. Fantastic movie (2/2) https://t.co/mqy75rPteh

How To Train Your Dragon 2 is a beautifully animated kids movie & pretty good sequel. I can’t stress how amazing the animation is. Great character growth/development for Hiccup & Toothless. It’s a bit more action & plot oriented then the original, but it’s still well made. (1/2)
I’ve been kinda mean to this movie, but seeing Toothless fight against the Alpha dragon & launch fireballs at it’s face is fucking awesome! https://t.co/Z3Bxje7Lbz

The most powerful dragon controls all dragons was stupid enough, but having Hiccup beak the hypnotism by believing that the real Toothless would never hurt anyone is even stupider. It’s basically “ the power was inside you all along” cliche.
It’s sad that he lost his father, but are there any animated characters or superheroes that can become heroes without losing a parent?

I love this movie, but this is just stupid. Just because Drago controls the most powerful dragon, why does that dragon have the ability to hypnotize other dragons? That’s the dragon equivalent of the one main computer controls all robots cliche & it’s dumb.

This movie is great & the animation is incredible, but the story in this one isn’t as strong as the first movie. This movie is much more plot & action oriented where the first one is much more character & story driven.

Out of all the design possibilities, why did they decide that the pirates of the Caribbean look would be the best. He literally looks like Javier Bardem in the last Pirates movie https://t.co/E6unz6unGy

In the backstory of what happened to Hiccup’s Mom shows that her feelings about dragons are true & they aren’t dangerous. So why did that one kidnap her? And why did she stay for 20 years? She said that it would be better if she stayed, but it doesn’t make a whole lot of sense.
You can tell that the Dragon Rider is legendary because they stand up as they ride their dragon.

It’s a coincidence that the villains name is Drago & he hates Dragons. What are the odds his parents would give him a name that’s one letter short of the word Dragon? It’s either a coincidence or just lazy writing.
The animation is so fantastic that you can see the strand of Toothless’ saliva as Astrid kisses Hiccup’s cheek. That’s incredible. And fucking disgusting 🤢🤮 https://t.co/Xlceu0U9Mk

I love the way the aged up Hiccup. As I said yesterday, Animated movies have the luxury of aging up or permanently changing a characters physical appearance. But this movie put in the extra work & it made it that much better. And the animation is just as gorgeous. https://t.co/vFdeB9sZKF
@The_5th_Turtle There was a HTTYD series on Cartoon Network that what happens between the events of the first & second plus a series on Netflix
In 5 years Hiccup apparently went from wimp to being the Man in the iron mask. https://t.co/wSQBBlvEsz

So after the events of the first movie, they have Dragon races. Understandable I guess, but how do you even have a race track for dragons? They can literally go anywhere. I know they’re trained, but it still seems they can go everywhere on the track. Better than Quidditch though
